summary: This document is an email chain from August 25, 2023, between FBI personnel discussing the search for a government witness who previously testified as a 'metadata expert' in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The purpose is to potentially use the same expert in the FTX case. The emails confirm Steve Flatley testified regarding metadata in the Maxwell case but was not allowed to give expert opinion testimony due to defense objections.

persons.name: Steve Flatley
persons.context: He testified regarding metadata in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, but the court did not allow him to give opinion as an expert due to defense objections. The SDNY is looking to potentially use him as an expert in the FTX case.

events.title: Steve Flatley's Testimony in Maxwell Case
events.description: Steve Flatley testified regarding metadata in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, but the court would not allow him to give opinion testimony as an expert due to objections from the defense.

events.title: Email Inquiry Regarding Expert Witness
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails to identify a government witness who previously testified as a 'metadata expert' in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, for potential use in the FTX case.

keyFacts: Steve Flatley testified regarding metadata in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.
The court in the Maxwell case did not allow Flatley to give opinion testimony as an expert due to defense objections.
The SDNY is looking to potentially use the same metadata expert (Flatley) in the unrelated FTX case and is seeking case precedent.
The email chain is a 2023 internal FBI discussion, not a contemporaneous document from the Maxwell investigation period.
